article.Heading: Will agri-friendly Budget 2016 help tractor ind see revival?
article.Summary: Escorts is now pinning its hopes on a good monsoon this year and an agriculture- friendly Budget.
article.Body:
Two consecutive drought years have severely hurt the tractor industry, whose fortunes are linked with that of the farm sector and this situation has hurt the agri-based auto sector very hard. However, a revival may just be round the corner for them. Escorts is now pinning its hopes on a good monsoon this year and an agriculture- friendly Budget.

India's 3rd largest tractor maker Escorts, for instance, has seen volumes plummet month after month in the last one year.

CNBC-TV18's Ronojoy Banerjee detailing the company's plans and how it expects the Budget to help.

S Sridhar, CEO- Agri-Machinery, Escorts says growth spurt will only get stronger if the finance minister indulges the sector in the upcoming Budget.

"Budget should focus on reviving sentiments, by tinkering with minimum support price (MSP),” he says.

The government has been throwing out strong hints that the focus will be on redressing rural distress, so if things play out as expected, tractor volumes may break the shackles after 4 long years.
